title: Custom Merchandise Design App

requirements.text: Create a product selector panel that allows users to choose from multiple merchandise categories: t-shirts, shirts, cups, and jugs. Each product type should have a distinct silhouette/outline used as the design canvas base.

quotes: design t-shirts, shirts, cups, jugs etc.

acceptanceCriteria: At least four product types are available: t-shirt, shirt, cup, jug
Selecting a product updates the canvas to display that product's shape
Active product is visually highlighted in the selector panel

requirements.text: Implement an interactive design canvas where users can place and manipulate design elements (text, shapes, color fills) on top of the selected product outline. Elements should be draggable, resizable, and deletable.

quotes: we can design t-shirts, shirts, cups, jugs etc.

acceptanceCriteria: Users can add text with customizable font size and color
Users can add basic shapes (rectangle, circle, triangle) with customizable fill colors
Design elements can be moved by dragging
Design elements can be resized via handles
Design elements can be deleted via a delete button or key

requirements.text: Provide a color picker tool that allows users to change the base color of the selected product (e.g., t-shirt color, cup color) and the fill/stroke color of individual design elements.
acceptanceCriteria: A color picker is accessible from the toolbar
Changing product base color updates the product silhouette/fill color
Changing element color updates the selected element's fill or text color

requirements.text: Add a design toolbar with tools for: adding text, adding shapes, selecting/moving elements, and changing colors. The toolbar should clearly indicate the currently active tool.
acceptanceCriteria: Toolbar contains at minimum: Select, Add Text, Add Shape, Color tools
Active tool is visually distinguished
Clicking a toolbar button activates that tool mode on the canvas

requirements.text: Implement a save design feature that persists the current design (product type, base color, and all design elements with their properties) to the backend so users can retrieve their saved designs.
acceptanceCriteria: A 'Save Design' button is present in the UI
Clicking it sends the design data to the backend and stores it
A success confirmation is shown after saving
Saved designs can be listed and loaded back into the canvas

requirements.text: Build a backend data model to store design projects. Each design should record: a unique ID, product type, base color, list of design elements (type, position, size, content, color), and creation timestamp.
acceptanceCriteria: Backend actor exposes functions: saveDesign, getDesign, listDesigns, deleteDesign
Design data is persisted in stable storage
Each design is uniquely identifiable by ID

requirements.text: Apply a bold, modern artisan workshop visual theme throughout the app. Use warm off-white and charcoal tones with vivid accent colors (e.g., amber or coral). Use clean sans-serif typography, a structured two-panel layout (tools sidebar + canvas area), and craft-inspired UI details. Enforce this style consistently across all pages and components.
acceptanceCriteria: Color palette uses warm neutrals (off-white, charcoal) with one vivid accent
Layout uses a clear sidebar + main canvas split
Typography is clean and legible
All components follow the same visual language

constraints: All backend logic must reside in a single Motoko actor in backend/main.mo
Do not use external image editing libraries that require server-side processing
Do not modify any files under frontend/src/hooks/ or frontend/src/components/ui
nonGoals: 3D product rendering or augmented reality preview
Exporting designs as downloadable image files
Uploading custom user images to the design canvas
